td.paragraph: His
lab results showed mild elevation in creatinine at 1.33, suggesting
possible early renal impairment or volume depletion. CBC, CMP, PT/INR
were within normal limits. He was advised to increase fluid intake to
support renal function and to follow a low-sodium, heart-healthy diet
to manage his cardiovascular risk factors. Continued adherence to
prescribed medications is essential for secondary prevention. He is
scheduled for in-office follow-up on 07/29 to reassess renal function
and cardiovascular status. All questions and concerns answered and
addressed. Heart healthy diet and healthy lifestyle modifications
were encouraged and endorsed. He is in agreement with the plan.

Patient was informed of the telemedicine visit by our office staff. Telemedicine was described in detail to the patient as the use of synchronous video and audio communication to provide clinical care from a distance. A telemedicine visit can provide the same medical standard of care for specific conditions. The patient was informed that the practice staff located at the provider's office would assist in carrying out any recommendations and clinical care.
Patient Location: Home
Lack of strict HIPPA Rules. Patient expressed verbal interest in the telemedicine visit and granted consent to proceed.
